intro: Astronia chartacea, commonly known as the chartaceous astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are broad and deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Astronia chartacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
